title: Orlando Pirates star Monnapule Saleng  to submit transfer request
body_text:
‘He’s not happy’: Orlando Pirates star Monnapule Saleng ‘to submit transfer request’
Orlando Pirates star Monnapule Saleng is making headlines after it was alleged that he is set to ‘submit a transfer request’ at the end of the season.
According to reports, Orlando Pirates star Monnapule Saleng is set to leave the Soweto giants at the end of the season.
The 26-year-old hasn’t starred for Orlando Pirates since December. His last game for the Buccaneers was against Al Ahly in the CAF Champions League group phase.
ORLANDO PIRATES STAR SALENG TO SUBMIT TRANSFER REQUEST AT THE END OF THE SEASON
In recent months, his absence has been making headlines, with the club stating that it is due to ‘personal issues.’
However, rumour has it that he had a fallout with the club after his camp asked for a pay rise.
Against the reports, his parents and close friends opened up about his woes in an exclusive interview with Sunday World.
Saleng’s parents said he was no longer happy at Orlando Pirates. His father noted his salary as one of the problems.
He said, “The problem is the contract. We would want him to stick with Pirates because it is one of the biggest clubs in the country.” The star player is apparently earning around R70 000 at Orlando Pirates.
Speaking to the media about his contractual issues, Saleng’s friend, Boikanyo Maine, said, “If he was not an important asset, Bafana could not have called him. We are requesting that Pirates consider what he wants.
“It’s unfair; imagine getting R70 000, but your contribution in most of the matches speaks volumes, while somebody [else] is getting R500 000.”
Despite being on the sideline for months, Saleng was included in the Bafana Bafana CHAN qualifiers squad that squared off against Egypt.
He was included in the first line and had his moments of brilliance in the 1-1 draw. Against his performance reports have it that Saleng is set to leave Orlando Pirates at the end of the season.
‘HE’S NOT HAPPY WITH HOW HE HAS BEEN TREATED’
However, reports suggest that he is set to submit a transfer request at the end of the season. The reasons behind his Orlando Pirates woes have been pinned on ‘contract issues’ and unfair treatment.
A close source to the star revealed to the media that Saleng wants out at Orlando Pirates.
“He’s not happy with how he has been treated by Pirates. He feels he deserves better, especially for what he has done for the club,” the source revealed to the media.
Kaizer Chiefs is reportedly monitoring his situation. Will the Soweto giants pull one of the most shocking transfers in PSL history?
IS HE STILL A BUCCANEER?
However, the reports come barely a few days after Orlando Pirates coach Mandla Ncikazi failed to answer media questions after being asked about Saleng’s future at Orlando Pirates.
After the Orlando Pirates’ 2-0 defeat, Mandla was asked if Saleng was still a Buccaneer.
The Orlando Pirates coach seemingly avoided the question and promised Orlando Pirates fans good football and better results in their next fixtures.
